content:
advertisement

For No Refund Theatres newest production A Moon for the Misbegotten director Steve Travis said members will examine a theme is not often explored on campus or within NRT PERIOD

It has a lot to do with family and a lot to do with loss Travis Class of  said PERIOD The theme is too important not to bring up. nRT will perform Eugene ONeills A Moon for the Misbegotten at  tonight in  Forum Building PERIOD Additional performances will be held at  p.m PERIOD and  p.m PERIOD Saturday in  Forum Building PERIOD

The play is a sequel to ONeills A Long Days Journey Into Night and follows the story of three characters  Phil Hogan Josie Hogan and Jim Tyrone  over a 24hour period PERIOD It explores the ideas of family love and forgiveness PERIOD

Luke Miller one of the assistant directors for the play said he likes A Moon for the Misbegotten because of ONeills writing skills PERIOD

He definitely has a way with words he said PERIOD Family is a major theme and we can all relate to that and hope the audience can too. miller Class of  said he has performed in six NRT plays since  but never helped direct one before PERIOD He said one of the major differences between acting and directing is having to see the play in a different light and looking at the play as a bigger picture. miller said he graduated from Penn State last year but the people involved with NRT keep him coming back PERIOD

Theyre all very committed to what they do Miller said PERIOD Its a great experience and hasnt gotten old yet. jim Dickey another assistant director said the week before each NRT play is considered hell week because the cast rehearses late every night PERIOD He said one of the most difficult parts of rehearsal is putting together the set which includes a large porch and the front of a house PERIOD

Several actors said they are excited to perform this weekend PERIOD

Dan Keiper said he will play T PERIOD Stedman Harder  A Moon for the Misbegotten is his first NRT play PERIOD

He said he has been preparing for the performance on and off since February and is excited to play a pompous character who has a different personality from himself PERIOD

Its fun to act and put on a persona and be free to be that person Keiper seniorlife sciences said PERIOD

Keiper said he hopes the audience appreciates the message the play sends out PERIOD

Families arent perfect  youre going to have fights and youre going to have conflict with each other Keiper said PERIOD You have to be honest with each other. jason Cassidy  an NRT veteran of  years since he also pursued his graduate degree at Penn State  said this play is his last performance with NRT PERIOD He said he will play Jim Tyrone PERIOD

His character is one of the best roles he has gotten with the club he said PERIOD

Its exciting to go out with a challenging role Cassidy Class of  said PERIOD
